dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what's, like, the big deal here? Another night, more riots, same old story, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what's, like, the big deal here? Another night, more riots, same old story, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, "same old story"? Did you, um, see the White House lights go out?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, same old story? Did you, um, see the White House lights go out?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Washington, D.C. saw the lights illuminating the White House go out sometime around 11 p.m. EST, as protesters set off fireworks nearby, with police responding by firing tear gas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so? Power outage, whatever. Happens.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so? Power outage, whatever. Happens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no. That was, like, deliberate. As fires burned across D.C. And people were, uh, smashing up stores.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no. That was, like, deliberate. As fires burned across D.C. And people were, uh, smashing up stores.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fires were set across the city, according to earlier reports...looters took goods from shops...with protesters using baseball bats to smash glass to gain access to goods.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, 'cause smashing up a Sephora really helps the cause, doesn't it? Half a million in merchandise, gone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, 'cause smashing up a Sephora really helps the cause, doesn't it? Half a million in merchandise, gone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Grocery stores were looted around the capitol, along with a Sephora, a Nike store, a CVS drugstore, a Target and a local liquor store, with protesters using baseball bats to smash glass to gain access to goods.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not just about that, A. St. John's Church had a fire in its basement. The National Guard is in 21 states.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not just about that, A. St. John's Church had a fire in its basement. The National Guard is in twenty one states.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fires were set across the city, according to earlier reports, including in the basement of the historic St. Johns Church. ... ABC News reported that the National Guard has been activated in 21 states plus Washington, D.C.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Trump's, uh, tweeting from a bunker, saying "LAW AND ORDER!" What else is new?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Trump's, uh, tweeting from a bunker, saying L A W A N D O R D E R! What else is new?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol. He has, however, tweeted about the protests, proclaiming LAW AND ORDER! around 7 p.m. EST Sunday night

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What's new? The President of the United States was reportedly, like, shaken enough to go to a bunker because of protests outside his home.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What's new? The President of the United States was reportedly, like, shaken enough to go to a bunker because of protests outside his home.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Reports say Trump was taken to an underground White House bunker as a precaution during Friday nights protests in the capitol.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or just avoiding the cameras. He's good at that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or just avoiding the cameras. He's good at that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But that's the point! It's not just, uh, a few people. Over 2,500 arrests this weekend. Slogans like "Justice for Floyd, or No Peace" are, like, everywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's the point! It's not just, uh, a few people. Over two thousand, five hundred arrests this weekend. Slogans like Justice for Floyd, or No Peace are, like, everywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2,564. Thats how many people were arrested over the weekend in connection to protests around the country, according to the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the Lincoln Memorial got graffiti. So inspiring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Lincoln Memorial got graffiti. So inspiring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sites around the National Mall were marked with graffiti, including the Lincoln Memorial, following Saturdays protests.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It shows the intensity. The sheer, um, frustration. It's about George Floyd, yes, but it's also, like, everything else. The pandemic, unemployment, police brutality. It's all justâ€¦ boiling over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It shows the intensity. The sheer, um, frustration. It's about George Floyd, yes, but it's also, like, everything else. The pandemic, unemployment, police brutality. It's all just... boiling over.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The death of George Floyd sparked nationwide outrage, coming amid the coronavirus pandemic and mass unemployment. Frustrations with police brutality towards black people boiled over...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Still feels like, uh, a lot of noise for not much change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still feels like, uh, a lot of noise for not much change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You really think the White House lights going dark and the President being in a bunker is "not much change"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You really think the White House lights going dark and the President being in a bunker is not much change?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, yeah, the lights came back on, eventually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, yeah, the lights came back on, eventually.
